org.ggp.base.util.propnet.factory.flattener

Class PropNetAnnotatedFlattener

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.ggp.base.util.propnet.factory.flattener.PropNetAnnotatedFlattener

  • public final class PropNetAnnotatedFlattener
extends java.lang.Object
    PropNetAnnotatedFlattener is an implementation of a GDL flattener that needs the rules to contain ( base ?x ) propositions that explicitly specify domains for all of the base propositions. This flattener should work on all sizes of games, but requires these explicit annotations to be present in the game description; it cannot infer them. A separate PropNetAnnotater class is able to generate these annotations. Sadly, it can only annotate relatively simple games. If there are no base propositions in a game description, PropNetAnnotatedFlattener will call the annotater in an attempt to generate annotations. To use this class: PropNetAnnotatedFlattener AF = new PropNetAnnotatedFlattener(description); List flatDescription = AF.flatten(); return converter.convert(flatDescription);

    • Method Detail

      • flatten

        public java.util.List<GdlRule> flatten()
        Flattens a game description using the following process:
        1. Records the rules in the description, and indexes them by head name.
        2. Creates an archive of rule instantiations, initialized with true rules.
        3. Creates every instantiation of each rule in the description and records the result.
        Parameters:
        description - A game description.
        Returns:
        An equivalent description, without variables.

      • noAnnotations

        public boolean noAnnotations()

      • expandTrue

        private void expandTrue(GdlSentence base,
              int index,
              java.util.LinkedList<GdlTerm> workingSet,
              java.util.List<GdlRule> results)
        Recursive method that uses a base rule to build a set of true instantiations. Given a base rule of the form (base name (arg1 a11 a12 ... a1n) ... (argn an1 an2 ... ann)) the method will return every possible combination of rules with name name and args arg1 through argn.
        Parameters:
        base - A base rule.
        index - The index of the rule being considered.
        workingSet - The list of GdlTerms built up so far.
        results - The list of results built up so far.

      • getInstantiations

        private java.util.List<GdlRule> getInstantiations(GdlConstant constant)
        Returns the list of instantiations associated with the head name constant, building one first if necessary. Rules with heads named legal are generated by looking up the instantiation for rules with heads named does and renaming the results.
        Parameters:
        constant - The name of the head of the rule to instantiate.
        Returns:
        A list of instantiations.

      • initializeInstantiations

        private java.util.Map<GdlConstant,java.util.List<GdlRule>> initializeInstantiations(java.util.List<Gdl> description)
        Creates an archive of rule instantiations from a game description, initialized with true rules, built using the reserved base keyword.
        Parameters:
        description - A game description.
        Returns:
        An archive of rule instantiations, indexed by head name.

      • instantiate

        private void instantiate(GdlRule template,
               int index,
               Substitution theta,
               java.util.Set<GdlRule> results)
        A recursive method for generating every possible instantiation of a rule. Instantiations are generated by created every possible combination of instantiations to the literals in the body of the rule so long as those instantiations do not conflict with each other.
        Parameters:
        template - The rule to instantiate.
        index - The literal in the body currently being considered.
        theta - The substitution built up so far.
        results - The list of results built up so far.

      • recordTemplates

        private java.util.Map<GdlConstant,java.util.List<GdlRule>> recordTemplates(java.util.List<Gdl> description)
        Records the rules in a game description, indexed by head name. Ignores rules that begin with the reserved base keyword.
        Parameters:
        description - A game description.
        Returns:
        An archive of rules, indexed by head name.
